title: Original Construction
description: Richard Spencer, a successful Philadelphia merchant, commissions construction of the mansion in the Greek Revival style popular among the city's elite. The four-story residence features 14 marble fireplaces, ornate plasterwork, and Italian marble mantels.

title: Civil War Era
description: During the Civil War, the Spencer family hosts Union officers and participates in fundraising efforts for the war. The mansion becomes a gathering place for Philadelphia's pro-Union society.

title: Centennial Celebration
description: The Spencer family hosts a grand reception during Philadelphia's Centennial Exhibition, welcoming dignitaries and visitors from around the world to view the home's architectural splendor.

title: Gilded Age Renovation
description: The Spencer-Ashbridge family undertakes a major renovation, adding the third-floor wing, updating gas lighting to electricity, installing indoor plumbing, and adding Victorian-era decorative elements. This transformation creates the layout guests experience today.

title: Modern Utilities
description: The mansion is fully electrified throughout, with the original gas chandeliers converted to electric fixtures. Central heating is installed, replacing coal-burning fireplaces (though the fireplaces remain as decorative features).

title: Suffragette Headquarters
description: Suffragette leader Anna Howard Shaw uses the mansion as her Philadelphia headquarters during the campaign for women's voting rights. The parlors host strategy meetings and fundraising events for the suffrage movement.

title: Prohibition Era
description: During Prohibition, the mansion's basement wine cellar is sealed, though rumors persist of the home hosting private gatherings for Philadelphia's elite during the 'dry' years.

title: Stock Market Crash
description: The Great Depression forces the Spencer-Ashbridge family to sell the property. It changes hands several times during the 1930s, serving briefly as a boarding house.

title: Post-War Restoration
description: After World War II, the property is purchased by the Harrison family, who restore many original features that had deteriorated during the Depression era. The formal gardens are replanted, and interior woodwork is refinished.

title: Bicentennial Era
description: During America's 200th birthday, the mansion is featured in Philadelphia's historic home tours, attracting thousands of visitors interested in the city's architectural heritage.

title: Historic Designation
description: The property is officially recognized by the Philadelphia Historical Commission for its architectural significance and well-preserved Greek Revival features. This designation provides protection and restoration guidelines.

title: Major Restoration Begins
description: New owners undertake a comprehensive, historically-sensitive restoration: structural reinforcement, systems modernization (HVAC, plumbing, electrical), kitchen and bathroom renovations, while preserving all original architectural elements.

title: Luxury Vacation Rental
description: Following completion of the restoration, the mansion opens as a luxury vacation rental, allowing guests to experience 170 years of Philadelphia history firsthand. The property quickly earns Superhost status on Airbnb.

title: Pandemic Resilience
description: During COVID-19, the mansion pivots to serve long-term stays for healthcare workers and families seeking spacious, private accommodations. The full kitchen and multiple living areas prove ideal for pandemic-era needs.

title: 170th Anniversary
description: The Rittenhouse Residence celebrates 170 years of continuous use, having welcomed thousands of guests and hosted countless historic moments. The mansion continues to blend its storied past with modern luxury.
